item.description:
The American Repertory Theatre in Cambridge is producing a stage version of Wim Wender's poetic film, set in 1980's Germany, while the Berlin Wall was still a fact of life. The simplistic plot revolves around a guardian angel who falls in love with a mortal girl. And "is a testimony to the little things we (humans) take for granted like a touch of a close friend or having a cup of coffee in a cold day". Members lof the A.R.T. will be present before the film starts and will speak about how a film is re-interpreted as theater among other things.

For those of you not familiar with the movie, here is a review:
http://uashome.alaska...

After the film, I will be holding a Meet-Up sign near the front row and then its off to a local cafe.
item.name: "Wings of Desire" as Theater
